oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the True Believers in Jesus' Name service, 1999 March 27
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with Shade Miller asking members to pray for others. Other members of the congregation make prayer requests. After the prayer, Delphia Nietzel and Gail Miller sing. They remain as more singers take the altar. A child joins them in song as Billy Lemming plays guitar with musical accompaniment form several other musicians. Shade Miller follows the singers and preaches and when his sermon ends, Brenda Brown sings and she is followed by Billy Lemming. Shade Miller lays hands on a member of the congregation while he sings. Billy Lemming testifies and Branden Nietzel anoints Jeff Brown. Rayford Dunn follows Billy Lemming and testifies. As he speaks, he holds the Bible for emphasis. Shade Miller follows him and preaches a sermon to the congregation. He reads an excerpt from the Bible during his sermon.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Expository preaching; Extemporaneous preaching; Imposition of hands; Lay preaching; Prayer; Singing -- Religious aspects; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Brown, Brenda; Brown, Jeff; Lemming, Billy; Miller, Gail; Miller, Shade; Nietzel, Brandon; Nietzel, Delphia
Church of the True Believers in Jesus' Name (Calhoun, Ga.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of the True Believers in Jesus' Name recordings and photographs
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
